greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest divisor of n^2 that is greater than n.
comment: Larger of two distinct numbers with minimum sum whose geometric mean is n. E.g., a(12) = 16 as 12^2 = 144 = 1*144 = 2*72 = 3*48 = 4*36 = 6*24 = 8*18 = 9*16, etc. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Feb 15 2003
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
example: a(45)=75 because divisors of 45^2 are {1, 3, 5, 9, 15, 25, 27, 45, 75, 81, 135, 225, 405, 675, 2025} and the smallest element greater than 45 is 75.
maple: with(numtheory): for n from 2 to 200 do a := divisors(n^2): b := a[(tau(n^2)-1)/2]: printf(`%d,`,n^2/b); od:
program: (PARI) { for (n=2, 1000, d=divisors(n^2); write("b063718.txt", n, " ", d[2 + length(d)\2]) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 28 2009
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 12 2001
